thread.title: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Springfield ends Hobart's league streak
thread.title_full: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Springfield ends Hobart's league streak

author: Times Sports Staff
title: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Springfield ends Hobart's league streak
text:
COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Springfield ends Hobart's league streak Times Sports Staff Finger Lakes Times | 0 comments 
SPRINGFIELD, Mass. — Just a few weeks ago, the Hobart football team had a 32-game regular season win streak snapped by Ithaca College, along with a nine-game road run. 
The 22nd-ranked Statesmen saw another long winning streak come to an end Saturday at the hands of Springfield. 
The Pride’s option attack churned out 60 rushes for 367 yards and erased a 13-0 halftime hole with 35 unanswered points in a 35-13 Liberty League win. 
The loss snapped Hobart’s 24-game league win streak. 
Quarterback Shane Sweeney (Geneva) returned after missing three games with an injury. He finished 13-of-24 for 110 yards and an interception. Backup Thomas Sydeski went 7-of-15 for 77 yards in relief. 
The Statesmen (4-2, 2-1) totaled just 24 yards on the ground and lost the time of possession battle 36:17 to 23:43. 
Tommy D’Antonio notched the lone touchdown for Hobart on a 72-yard fumble return late in the first quarter. Kicker Sean Kirshe connected on field goals of 21 and 28 yards in the second quarter for a 13-0 halftime lead. 
Springfield (4-2, 2-1) went ahead with a 14-point third quarter that included Billy DeLay’s 20-yard rushing touchdown and Steve Comee’s offensive fumble recovery in the end zone that capped a 15-play, 80-yard drive, taking 8:50 off the clock. 
Jake Eglintine began a 21-point fourth quarter with a 24-yard touchdown pass to Joe Festo. 
Trayvon Toney piled up 13 tackles on defense for the Statesmen, who are idle next weekend. Marcus Jemison was right behind with 12 stops. James Hedger added a sack while Michael Harper had two tackles for a loss.
